result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Miller

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Anthony Miller not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask not in court.  
Attorney William Ackell  in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Plea and Sentencing.
 Defendant  has a pending  matter before the court, which has been adjourned. This case to follow.   
Defense counsel was unavailable at the time of hearing and provided the next court date. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Status conference scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Anthony Miller not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM.  Case in court for a Status Conference. Discussion held as to defendant felony matter which is schedule for a Plea and Sentencing.
Defense request this case be transferred and heard alongside pending matter.  Granted by the Court. Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court via Zoom, defendant Anthony Miller not in court, in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a status conference.  Defense informs the court that the defendant has a felony matter and would like an adjournment until after the felony case's next court date. 
State informed the court there is a potential global offer and requests the court to authorize transfer.
Court authorize transfer to Branch 45 for purposes of a global resolution, if accepted.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to branch 19.

  Status conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Anthony Miller not in court, in custody. Julie Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a Status Conference. Defendant has a pending felony matter. Defense counsel request time to determine the status of the felony matter.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Miller not in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  .  
Case in court for a  Plea heaing on 5-10-2022. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. 
Defense counsel advises the court he has been unsuccessful in contacting client.  State advises the court defendant is in custody on pending felony matter.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19 . Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case in court for a Plea Hearing. Defendant failed to appear. Defense counsel in trial. 
Counsel notified  in person defendant failed to appear and he will contact defendant to appear on 5-11-2022 at 8:30am.
Court held matter over until 5-11-2022 at 8:30am.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. Defendant appeared on Zoom prior to case being called on the record.
Attorney Domask in person. Court waived defendant's appearance. Defense request a plea and sentencing date.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19. Plea hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Pretrial Services Discharge Report

Defendant Anthony Miller not in court.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense counsel contacted the court and advised that he is in trial in another branch and asks for an adjournment. 
Court orders matter adjourned. 
  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Amended Supervision Report
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report

Defendant Anthony Miller in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM. Case in court for a Pretrial Conference.
Defense in receipt of discovery and offer and request time to discuss with defendant.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.

Received and Filed.

Pre-trial conference on February 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.W.

Defendant Anthony Miller in court with attorney Evan Barrett Weitz.  Defendant Anthony Miller in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Anthony Miller appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  This hearing will be streamed Live through DACAST:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/21a87aec-ffb6-5325-fb81-55812563aa79  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
